overall_summary: The reasoning focuses on handling a short time-series with daily seasonality and irregularities. The primary approach involves decomposing the series into hourly seasonal indices normalized by daily averages, then forecasting via these indices scaled by an overall historical average. The analysis balances methodological considerations (SARIMA, Prophet) with practical constraints (limited data, text-based environment), ultimately selecting a statistically grounded but manually feasible solution.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
Non-repeating daily patterns with varying hourly magnitudes
key_insights: Normalization of hourly values by daily averages to isolate seasonal effects
Use of multi-day averaging to compensate for limited historical data
Explicit rejection of complex models (SARIMA, LSTM) due to data scarcity
Importance of maintaining daily average consistency via index normalization
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with multi-step statistical decomposition, manual index calculations, and normalization logic. Combines theoretical model comparisons with practical implementation constraints.
